reviews.review_msg: Cares a lot about his students, and is very approachable. Whether you're taking POL as your major or an elective, go with Rado.

Dimitrov is a great prof who displays genuine care for his student's success. He may initially come off as cold and having high expectations, but I believe this stems from his vast professional background. He makes criteria and expectations quite clear and gives students a roadmap for success. He is also quite funny and his lectures are engaging.

This is my 3rd time taking class with Rado. He is passionate in his area and genuinely cares about students' experiences and takeaways from the course. His grading is flexible, and he is always willing to give feedback and career advice. If you are interested in IR, definitely go with Rado. I have to say some of the comments are clearly misleading

Worst prof ever!!! No empathy what so ever. Does not check emails rants about his experience doesn't even finish lecture. Poor class structure. Changes the syllabus based on feedback from few students yet when u speak to him about excruciating circumstances he does not accommodate even if the faculty is involvedExpects students to be available 24/7

This class has been a total boys club, men are always talking over the women, comes across as kinda misogynistic. Probably would be a better experience if you are a man. Not very personable. Seems like he isn't very interested in teaching. Also bro can't stop plugging his own website.

Not accommodating or caring to students with disabilities (refuses to even acknowledge it). All the life advice he gives in class are common sense and nothing sensational. His better-than-all attitude takes away from the diplomatic elements he tries to teach in class. Would not take again.

I took POL 349 with Professor Dimitrov. While he was a fantastic lecturer, I found that he was not very approachable. He is very smart in his field and his lectures are very interesting, though, so that somewhat makes up for it. Nevertheless, I will not take another course with him.

Dimitrov is the best professor I've had in my four years at SFU. This is the first time I have felt that a professor genuinely cares about the careers and the lives his students will have after his course. He has a wealth of experience working in diplomacy and international relations. The simulation was the most engaging in-class assessment method.

Prof. Dimitrov is one of the best and most memorable professors I've met. He is hilarious, eloquent, and knowledgeable; you'll definitely learn a lot from his lectures since they are concise yet insightful. Fair grading and workload. One thing to keep in mind is that active participation is important: read assigned articles, take notes, and engage.

Dr. Dimitrov truly cares about his students. All of the assessments were fair, and the simulation was particularly fun. He always includes anecdotes about his diplomatic experiences and that enhances the class tremendously. He assigns a lot of reading but it tends to be interesting and well-integrated in the lecture. I highly recommend him!

Dr. Dimitrov is my favourite prof at SFU! His lectures are engaging and his stories about his personal experience in the field are inspiring. The simulations he does in this class are captivating and teach you real-life skills. He grades fairly and the assignments are clearly outlined. I highly recommend taking a class with Dr. Dimitrov if you can!
Dr Dimitrov is the best professor I have so far at SFU. His lectures are engaging, he's incredibly knowledgeable, and he marks very fairly. He is also is very accessible outside of class time

Very nice and shows great insight. He comes across as intimidating at first, but he really does care about his students. I took POL 141 this semester and I will be taking POL 349 with him this spring!

Dr. Dimitrov is an old-school professor: he expects you to know dates and names of treaties. Also, GO TO CLASS! A lot of what he discusses isn't in the book! Exams are fair, but require consistent engagement in the course to excel. His lectures are very enriching, as he is a talented speaker and has a wealth of knowledge.

Professor Dimitrov's lectures are without a doubt the most interesting of any class I've taken. While he provides slides it is very clear he knows exactly what he's talking about and has had hands-on experience in this field. His exams are notably difficult, but the content is so interesting they're not that horrible to study for. Highly rec.

Radoslav Dimitrov's first year POL 141 course provides a great introduction to world politics. He seems overqualified for this position, being able to go into great depth on topics concerning International Relations off the top of his head. Definitely attend the lecture and take notes there because they seemed to be more helpful than the textbook.

Professor Dimitrovs class has been my favourite so far at SFU. This class was graded by 4 assignments, which includes a simulation. The simulation (group project) seemed confusing at times, but was a very rewarding learning experience. The midterm was lecture based (but take notes of everything he says!). Kind and assessable outside of class.
